dialogue.text: The child draws spirals on everything—notebooks, walls, sand. When asked why, she says: 'This is how questions move.'
Mommy says I'm different every day. But also the same. Like the spiral—it goes round but also forward.
When I grow up, I want to be a question helper. Like the people at the spiral garden.
Look, I made the question bigger today. It needed more room to dance.

psychological_notes: Shows next evolution where children raised with normalized uncertainty from birth demonstrate healthier development. Amara represents generation that never experiences existential crisis because uncertainty integrated from start. Questions as play rather than terror.
philosophical_underpinning: Existential uncertainty as natural developmental stage rather than crisis
therapeutic_direction: Prevention of existential trauma through early integration
